Job Title: Research Data Analyst- Center for Autism Research
Description: Req ID: 19527 Shift: Days Employment Status: AF - Active - Regular - Full Time Job Summary The Center for Autism Research is conducting a wide range of studies seeking to identify causes of ASD, and to explore novel methods of diagnosis, effective interventions, and other supports for families throughout the region affected by ASD. We are seeking a full-time Research Data Analyst to support the goals of a research program that uses big data drawn from electronic health records to more precisely describe the autism phenotype and generate new tools to detect and measure ASD in CHOP patients. The Research Data Analyst will work closely with the Lead Investigator to mine, manipulate, and analyze clinical research data from electronic health records and other large- scale clinical and research datasets. He/She will maintain and apply knowledge of appropriate computer systems and programming tools including R, python, SQL, and git/github, as well as knowledge of medical terminology and health care and research records. The Research Data Analyst will meet regularly with the PI, Lead Investigator, and Project Manager, and will be a member of CAR’s Data Core. Prior experience with some or all of these duties is a plus but is not necessary; many of the Research Data Analyst’s duties can be learned on the job. Successful applicants will be highly self-motivated and fast learners who enjoy working in bustling research environments. This position offers valuable research experience in preparation for applying to graduate school. As a member of CAR, the Analyst will have the opportunity to attend lectures and seminars on recent findings in autism research and data science, allowing exposure to scientific leaders in the field. Job Responsibilities Job Responsibilities: Participate in research by analyzing, abstracting, entering, and presenting data using research databases, including EPIC, REDCap, and MySQL. Review patient charts and record, analyze, and abstract data with 100% accuracy. Recombine data to create datasets and database content, including creating summary variables for preliminary analysis, using R, python, and SQL with 100% accuracy. Coordinate abstract writing and presentation under the direction of the Lead Investigator. Keep up-to-date with all possible database capabilities as well as related software and technology, including researching and applying new packages and modules to meet project needs. Participate in clinical research within area and in other activities to support the project. Perform other related duties that support the CAR Data Core more generally. Preferred Education, Experience & Cert/Lic Preferred Education: Masters degree Required Education: BA/BS degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Information Technology, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Job Title: Clinical Data Analyst, Quality Assurance Abstracting

Data accuracy and timeliness are maintained to support ongoing needs of internal quality review and process improvement, as well for reporting to outside agencies. Position Overview At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. As a PART-TIME Detection & Investigation Analyst within PNC's Deposit Operations Services Group , you will be based in Philadelphia, PA at the Eastwick building. You will be part of a diversified financial services firm that reflects the needs, values and goals of our customers, employees, communities and shareholders. Your role will be institutional in helping to maintain PNC's reputation for excellence with our customers by living our brand and exhibiting our core values. The Deposit Operations Services Group is responsible for the early detection, control and prevention of losses due to fraudulent items on customer checking accounts. As an integral part of this dynamic and progressive team, you will review the DSS system for potentially fraudulent items on customer accounts. PNC is committed to integrity, teamwork and customer focus through every aspect of our daily work and performance. You will implement this philosophy as you use defined research procedures to identify possible fraudulent items. Your strong analytical and communication skills will serve you well as you research and analyze potentially fraudulent situations. Please refer to Scheduled Days/Hours section for additional scheduling information Job Profile Participates in reviewing and investigating customer cases, reports, and work for potential and actual loss; minimizes fraud, AML and/or organizational risk. Responsible for early detection of suspicious activity, control and prevention of losses. Under supervision, researches and analyzes bank activities and reports to detect and prevent possible fraudulent and illegal activities. Escalates issues as appropriate. Uses defined research procedures to identify and resolve issues. Follows standards and practices to mitigate fraud, AML and other risk exposure and loss. Prepares and maintains appropriate documentation of analysis performed and coordinates with internal or external stakeholders as appropriate. Core Competencies Manages Risk - Basic Experience Assesses and effectively manages all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure activities are in alignment with the bank's and unit's risk appetite and risk management framework. Customer Focus - Basic Experience Knowledge of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions, and ability to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions. Job Specific Competencies Anti-money Laundering/Sanctions Policies and Procedures - Basic Experience Knowledge of and ability to prevent or report money laundering and Sanctions-related activities in banking and financial services industry. Business Ethics - Basic Experience Knowledge of practices, behaviors, applicable laws, rules, and regulations governing proper business conduct; ability to demonstrate ethical behavior in diverse situations. Business Process Improvement - Basic Experience Knowledge of and ability to use methods for identifying, evaluating, introducing and implementing more efficient approaches to performing business related activities. Standard Operating Procedures - Basic Experience Knowledge of and ability to design, implement and evaluate standard operating procedures affecting daily and strategic business operations in order to increase operational efficiency. Information Capture - Basic Experience Knowledge of the processes and the ability to identify, capture and document relevant business information in an auditable, organized, understandable and easily retrievable manner. Problem Solving - Basic Experience Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations. Effective Communications - Basic Experience Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors. Decision Making and Critical Thinking - Basic Experience Understanding of the issues related to the decision-making process; ability to analyze situations fully and accurately, and reach productive decisions. Fraud Detection and Prevention - Basic Experience Knowledge of and ability to utilize processes, tools, and techniques for detecting, addressing and preventing fraudulent situations. Operational Risk - Basic Experience Knowledge of policies and processes for operational risk management; ability to use tools, data, and best practices to identify, assess, and manage operational risk exposures. Required Education and Experience Roles at this level typically do not require a university / college degree, but do require related experience or product knowledge to accomplish primary duties. Typically requires 1+ years of related experience. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education and experience (including military service) may be considered. EEO Statement PNC provides equal employment opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law

Overview The CMMS Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the enterprise computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) that provides maintenance data reporting across Contract Operations groups. This role is responsible for analyzing and reporting consolidated maintenance and asset management data, benchmarks, KPIs and trends. The CMMS Data Analyst liaises with the IT Director – Enterprise Applications and with the system vendor to understand and manage user security, system upgrades and change requests. In addition, this role supports users, managers and executives by helping them to create meaningful dashboards and reports specific to their roles and their facilities. Must have specific experience with eMaint CMMS software implementation, maintenance and management Must be familiar with the goals and objectives for a CMMS program within the water and wastewater industry This position is also open to remote location Responsibilities This position Develops, builds and oversees the cross facility/project reporting and centralization of maintenance data. Collaborates with corporate, regional, and project staff in the development of user dashboards and reports for consolidation and review of key data from multiple project databases. Reviews project-level data and produces management reports at various levels analyzing maintenance and asset management data, benchmarks, KPIs and trends Assists management with data interpretation and develops functional ways to present data to facilitate management oversight Collaborates with Regional/Project Managers to initialize and build new facility/project databases during the implementation phase and during the onboarding of new projects during the transition process. Understands and assists with standardizing work processes, standards and SOPs to ensure accurate, efficient and consistent data capture in the field Assists Project/Plant Managers with troubleshooting databases Assists with new project implementation, database set-up Provides training for new CMMS users Liaises with IT to ensure that the CMMS is managed in accordance with all Company protocols and to understand how periodic vendor software upgrades will impact use of the system. Qualifications EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS _Education/Experience_ : BS degree and 7-10 years related experience. Experience in the water/wastewater utilities sector and understanding of water and wastewater operations and maintenance is required. _Technical_ : Extensive experience and expertise in CMMS report-building and use of reporting tools. Skilled at aggregating data collected from multiple data sources. Experienced with interpreting and analyzing data and trends using statistical analysis. Understands database permissions and data security. Specific experience with eMaint is required. Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office applications is required. _Communication_ : Communicates clearly, professionally and concisely; verbally and in writing. Contributes to a positive internal & external customer experience. Maintains composure in challenging situations. Collaborates with others. Seeks constructive feedback. Promotes a culture of diversity, respect and accountability. Constructively challenges others through productive discussion. _Problem Solving & Quality_ : Understands and values the importance of accuracy in regulatory compliance reporting. Pays attention to detail and checks work for quality. Skilled at troubleshooting complex problems. Escalates issues appropriately. Shares suggestions to improve quality and productivity. _Managing for Results_ : Works independently with minimal supervision. Follows all company policies and SOPs. Manages multiple tasks. Meets time commitments for completing projects and assignments. Demonstrates flexibility in workflow and scheduling. _Leadership & Initiative_: Demonstrates a positive attitude. Acts in accordance with company vision, mission and values. Takes accountability for own performance. Willing to take on additional assignments. Seeks out opportunities for development. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The work environment is characteristic of an office environment: sitting, standing, walking, bending and lifting are required to perform job responsibilities. The employee must occasionally lift and move up to 20 lbs. TRAVEL Periodic travel estimated at 25-30%.

Brief summary of the role: The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for supporting data management activities for multiple aspects of study set-up, conduct, data auditing and closeout by performing data review and cleaning activities as well as data entry and QC checks in order to provide the highest quality of data, as contracted. Responsibilities: Conduct clinical data review and/or listing of data entered by project sites and determine compliance and plausibility as outlined within the project data review guidelines; determine course of action to be taken to resolve data discrepancies and inconsistencies, such as additional site query, data acceptance or escalation. Review query data responses provided by sites and evaluate if the data meets the criteria as outlined within the project data review guidelines and determine the necessity of a query, re-query or other course of action is required. Identify issues during the data review process that are lacking in current guidelines, research the issues and provide the Lead Data Manager feedback on root cause and recommended remedial action on issues or processes that are ineffective or inefficient to ensure project data quality standards are met. Participate in the development and entry of test data and in user acceptance testing of electronic data capture software and documenting all findings and actions in accordance with testing guidelines to determine if the functionality of the systems is accurately working. Track and file study documents into the project tracking tool, and conduct regular audit of project documentation to determine if all documents are accounted for and confirm compliance with file transfer requirements. Assist with data processing for paper CRF’s as related to tracking and entry into the clinical database. Participate in Quality Control (QC) review of manually entered paper CRF data by comparing to database listing output and documenting any inconsistencies as well as participate in data audits as required. Requirements: BA/BS degree in biological sciences or related disciplines preferred Minimum of 2 years Data Management experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience Knowledge of EDC systems such as Medidata Rave, Oracle Inform or other EDC platform is preferred, but not required Working knowledge of MS Office products to support word processing, e-mail applications and spreadsheet activities. Electronic data capture experience preferred. Knowledge of medical terminology, clinical data, and/or ICH/Good Clinical Practices preferred; Highly organized with attention to detail; Ability to work well in a team environment to reach organizational goals and collaborate with peers, works well independently with minimal supervision; above average written and oral communication skills; Good interpersonal skills.

At Boston Children’s Hospital, success is measured in patients treated, parents comforted and teams taught. It’s in discoveries made, processes perfected, and technology advanced. In major medical breakthroughs and small acts of kindness. And in colleagues who have your back and patients who have your heart. As a teaching hospital of Harvard Medical School, our reach is global and our impact is profound. Join our Anesthesia Department and discover how your talents can change lives. Yours included. This Applications Developer will be responsible for: Designing, implementing, and maintaining ETL processes to gather and analyze information from different hospital databases and datasets. Creating reports and visualizations to fulfill requests from clinicians, researchers, and administrators using a variety of database and analytic technologies. Modeling database needs based on project requirements and maintaining data dictionaries and documentation associated with these data models. Identifying performance bottlenecks in legacy databases and ETL processes; proposing and implementing changes to existing code to address these issues. Working directly with a diverse userbase, including clinicians, clinical researchers, and administrators in the department to understand requirements and needs and provide solutions. Working alongside a team of analysts and developers to understand a project’s clinical characteristics and implement technical solutions. To qualify, you must have: Proficiency writing SQL queries and designing database models (1-3 years of experience required). Familiarity with the design and implementation of data collection systems and ETL processes in a Production environment (1-3 years of experience required). Programming expertise in a scripting language such as R, Python, or Scala (1+ year(s) of experience preferred). Experience building dynamic visualizations using the toolsets listed above (1+ year(s) of experience preferred). Strong analytical and communication skills, with great attention to detail and accuracy. An ability to understand the real-world context behind technical questions and requirements. A strong focus on customer service and the ability to work with clinicians and administrators with no technical background. Experience with ETL products such as Informatica or Pentaho; reporting tools such as Jasper, Crystal Reports, Microstrategy, or Tableau; and statistical software a plus. As a key team member, you will have a lasting impact on the team’s culture, productivity, and success. We think you’ll love it here if you are: Inspired to leverage data science to further research in the healthcare industry. Interested in learning what it takes to solve difficult problems and choosing the appropriate toolset to create a solution. Interested in being part of a team, working with both technical and non-technical peers. Self-motivated and disciplined to work both independently and in a group setting. Boston Children’s Hospital offers competitive compensation and unmatched benefits, including a, affordable health, vision and dental insurance, generous levels of time off, 403(b) Retirement Savings plan, Pension, Tuition Reimbursement and discounted rates on T-passes (50% off). Flexible schedule (if applicable). Discover your best. Boston Children’s Hospital is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

General Information JOB TITLE: Data Analyst FTE: 1.0 Job Description: A recent study by EY-Parthenon Education revealed numerous challenges in BPS related to monitoring the progress of students who demonstrate early warning indicators for becoming off-track in high school. We know that there are high concentrations of these students in a small number of open-enrollment high schools. And we know that the vast majority of these students show risk factors in middle school and/or 9th grade that are highly correlated with their potential for dropping out of high school. We seek a Data Analyst who can help us more strategically leverage this information to plan appropriate interventions for and communication with this population of students and their families. We are particularly interested in developing dashboards to help the Headmasters of open-enrollment high schools better plan for the arrival of incoming 9th graders who have concerning early warning indicators based on their prior academic and social-emotional history. Additionally, we anticipate that the Data Analyst will be used to help us track the efficacy of any new interventions that are tested out over the next two years to intervene with this population, including district-wide initiatives to combat chronic absenteeism, which is a key metric for monitoring progress toward keeping more students on-track to graduate high school. REPORTS TO: Tommy Welch, Associate Superintendent RESPONSIBILITIES: Conduct analysis, develop reports, and build tools to support work for the Office of the Superintendent Provide support and thought partnership to other teams in across central office and schools Develop a predictive model for analyzing elementary and middle school Early Warning Indicators (EWIs) that can be leverage by high schools for prioritizing tiered interventions with 9th grade students. Work with a cross-section of Headmasters to develop and pilot data dashboards for monitoring student progress and informing short-term decision making about programming and resource allocation. Study the challenges associated with increasing exam school access and diversity, including documenting where the greatest opportunity gaps exist among K-5, K-6, 6-8 and K-8 feeder schools (i.e. where we have the highest concentrations of potential exam school candidates who are not receiving proactive supports to reduce entry barriers). Participate in other district-wide efforts to gather, analyze and present data relevant to risk factors associated with monitoring the progress of middle and high school students. QUALIFICATIONS - REQUIRED: Bachelor’s degree Strong analytic capabilities, familiarity with research design, and leadership skills Data expertise and outstanding communication skills Most importantly, candidates must be committed to education and believe in the importance of data-informed decision making Current authorization to work in the United States - Candidates must have such authorization by their first day of employment QUALIFICATIONS - PREFERRED: Master’s degree and at least four years of full-time work experience Experience as a researcher and/or analyst Experience working in a school-based setting (teacher, administrator, external partner, etc.) TERMS: Managerial Tier C. _This position is subject to the City of Boston residency requirement._ Please refer to www.bostonpublicschools.org/ohc (under "Employee Benefits and Policies") for more information on salary and compensation.
