3-5 years experience Full-time ASAP We currently seek a Marketing Data Analyst to support performance reporting and analysis for various client engagements, including traditional, digital, and social media programs. The goal is to maximize our clients’ return on marketing investment through ongoing program measurement, disciplined in- market testing, and results-based performance management. RESPONSIBILITIES MERGE is a collaborative company. While this description includes core functional responsibilities, all of our employees are active members of the team, flexible in assisting the company as it grows and evolves. This expectation requires each person to be capable of adapting to the dynamics of a client driven environment. We’re as interested in your human side as your technical expertise. The ideal candidate will be upbeat, optimistic and happy to help the team. Core functional responsibilities include: Collaboration with cross-functional teams (Account, Creative, Media and Technology) to define measurable program goals and objectives Development of measurement plans outlining project objectives, measurement framework, data sources, and reporting frequency Collaboration with technical teams to implement and test tracking prior to project delivery, including tracking tag generation from website analytics systems (e.g., Google/Adobe Analytics) and/or ad serving systems (e.g., DCM, Conversant, Sizmek) Ongoing tracking, maintenance, and issue resolution with regard to measurement framework while programs are in market (e.g., monitoring ad delivery, confirming tracking tags are working) Aggregation of data from various sources (including but not limited to: site analytics, third party ad servers, social listening platforms, call center data, CRM, etc.) into integrated report templates or dashboards Data review and analysis, as well as presentation of findings to internal teams and/or clients Supporting the overall Analytics vision for the agency, including ongoing refinement, implementation, and maintenance of processes, tools, and templates QUALIFICATIONS 3-5 years of experience in the media, interactive, and/or analytics departments of an agency Experience with web site analytics packages (Google, Adobe), online ad serving systems (DCM, Conversant, Sizmek) Mastery of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Detail-oriented and well organized Strong qualitative and quantitative skills Analytical mindset, comfortable working with numbers Strong communication skills (written & verbal) Ability to manage timelines and multitask across a variety of projects Ability to work independently as well as part of a team Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Business, Mathematics, Statistics or Economics; advertising, direct marketing, CRM or digital background desirable VALUES Ability. Ability to bring the highest level of skill and competence. Agility. To keep us flexible, nimble and incredibly responsive to client and market demands. Humility. Constant seekers of new ideas, amazing collaborators and builders of those around us.

The Contracts Specialist/Data Analyst for the Procurement Department will be responsible for reviewing and processing various contract documents and to maintain the Total Contract Manager (TCM) SciQuest eSourcing module. The incumbent will also be responsible for financial system data extraction and analysis from the PeopleSoft, Buyways System; will work on areas of reporting and query functions and will prepare monthly, quarterly and annual reports; and will develop and maintain data standards documentation. The Contracts Specialist/Data Analyst will provide contract support to Buyways end-users and will also assist with the Procurement Card Program (ProCard). The incumbent should be able to interact effectively with internal department buyers, management, and external vendors. Examples of Duties: Review and process Contract for Services (CFS) and Sub-Contract Terms and Conditions and associated paperwork in accordance with Board of Trustees (BOT) policy, UMass Boston Policies, and procedures, and applicable state regulations; Assist end-users in the preparation of Contract for Services and Sub-Contract Terms and Conditions, review contracts for accuracy, request legal review of contracts when applicable, and obtain required signatures; Process and maintain all types of contracts/agreements, including but not limited to memorandum of understanding, revenue contracts, software licenses, maintenance agreements, and leases; work independently to review and maintain complex contracts/agreements that require independent judgement and thinking, in accordance with Commonwealth laws and regulations and University purchasing policies and procedures; Maintain database (Total Contract Manager) of all contract activities; provide a series of regular reports and ad-hoc reports to the Director for Procurement, Assistant Vice Chancellor for Contracts and Compliance and maintain a list of local and minority vendors and strive to do business locally; Analyze data for monthly transaction reports to identify duplicate or other errors and address issue with the Director of Procurement and the Assistant Vice Chancellor for Contracts and Compliance; prepare matrix reports based on purchase orders/amounts/account codes and Procard expenditure and reallocation reports; provide technical expertise regarding database design and development; Perform basic statistical analysis reports and develop graphs and presentations; assemble, summarize and analyze data; prepare reports, present findings and make recommendations to the Director of Procurement and Assistant Vice Chancellor for Contracts and Compliance; As required (individually and as back-up role to the Contracts Administrator), conduct public bidding and process contracts for construction/renovation projects as well as new construction, when appropriate; work with the Division of Capital Asset Management and Maintenance (DCAMM), University legal counsel and state official as it pertains to the contracting process; interpret Massachusetts General Laws (Chapter 149, 30§39M), and ensure compliance at all times during project development and execution; Assist in the development of bid specifications for goods and service, qualification of bidders and review selection process for the vendor selected to provide the quality of goods or services requested; ensure fair, ethical and legal practices are given to all bidders; post, receive, open and evaluate bids proposal as required and using Bonfire eSourcing too; make determination as to the most advantageous vendor for established criteria in accordance with the University policies and procedures and Massachusetts General Laws; Review licenses and leases and terms and conditions with vendor, department staff; Responsible for processing all state-funded projects through the Massachusetts Management Accounting and Reporting System (MMARS); serve as the campus liaison for all MMARS purchasing transactions; interact with the State Comptroller Division and attend on and off campus MMARS related meetings and training; Assist end users/departments with all contract related issues to interpret complex terminology, as well as purchasing policies and procedures questions, account codes, commodities and Buyways questions; Coordinate Procard trainings and prepare relevant materials for workshops being offered for Procard and other University procurement procedures; Process Procard applications and assist departments with ongoing Procard maintenance and card adjustments; ensure required approval are obtained and properly documented; maintain Procard files; Maintain the department’s Continuity of Operations Plan (COOP) Kit; Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree, Master Degree in business management or computer science preferred, and a minimum of three-five (3-5) years of experience in a college or university business oriented setting required. Knowledge of SQL helpful and complete Microsoft Office Suite preferred and MS Word, MS Excel and PowerPoint proficiency required. Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of PeopleSoft and Adobe Pro preferred. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Working knowledge of basic procurement policies, procedures, and practices; Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment; Ability to handle numerous projects in various states of completion; Ability to work independently and use independent judgment and thinking; Ability to work cooperatively with a wide range of individuals, in a diverse and complex environment; Strong oral and written communication skills; Strong commitment to customer service.

Description At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who help make that possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life to turning textbooks into laptop lessons, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small. Position Summary: NOTE: MUST be fully authorized to work in the U.S. No OPTs, visa sponsorship, visa transfers or future green card sponsorships. Product Analytics is transforming education, and Pearson is at the forefront of using data to improve teaching and student learning. With over 10 million higher education students annually studying in our MyLabs, Mastering, and other digital learning products, we generate a lot of data. We also have great instructional and assessment content. Our product teams are building adaptive and intelligent learning systems to derive actionable insights about our learners, instructors and institutions. Today, our learning products are delivering personalized experiences worldwide, establishing a powerful foundation for new research and innovation. We are looking for a uniquely talented individual who can turn data into insight and action. A Data Analyst in Global Product Analytics consults with internal customers to understand their business questions, and then delivers analyses to meet those needs. Along the way, instrumentation is specified and deployed, data pipelines and processing defined, and visualizations built. The end results help optimize our customer experience and inform the entire product life-cycle from ideation to launch to constant improvement. We are looking for strong critical thinking skills, the ability to navigate various data environments, hands-on technical ability in data, and a drive to understand our business. The successful candidate will be a thought partner to our customers and will assist them in understanding data and generating further questions. This individual will dig into raw and processed data (backend DBs, Google Analytics, and event/message data), transform information into visualizations using Tableau, R, Excel, etc., and effectively articulate the story behind the data. The role involves close interaction with product management, user design groups, data warehouse developers, data architects, and software development teams. Strong communication and interpersonal skills are critical. High Level Responsibilities: \+ Partner with product managers and content teams to prioritize, scope and perform in-depth analyses that drive and inform strategic decisions, especially related to product development and growth initiatives. \+ Develop insights to answer complex questions via thorough and well-designed data analyses using SQL, R, and Tableau and other tools with a focus on product efficacy and the optimization of learning outcomes. \+ Provide thought leadership with internal stakeholders so that they may be able to better leverage insights. \+ Connect with Product and Engineering teams to produce instrumentation to generate insightful measurements on our new and existing products. \+ Work across departments and collaborate with business managers, user experience designers, systems architects, engineering delivery teams, project managers, QA, and operations teams. \+ Identify information and visualizations required to tell a compelling and meaningful story using data; establish baselines and monitor growth or decline in metrics. \+ Contribute to tools, documentation, and instruction to enable our customers to increasingly use data independently. \+ Track and report on the status of deliverables in a project schedule. Serve as a point of contact to our business partners and cross-functional teams for day-to-day management of the Analytics program. \+ Help create and maintain the plan, schedules, and other documentation required to effectively manage deliverables to our customers. Expected Results: \+ Effective instrumentation to remediate data gaps \+ Analysis and insights delivered across our products \+ Smart, intuitive data/insight tools that promote data-driven decision making \+ Strong relationships with our internal stakeholders Qualifications Competencies: \+ Leadership in an environment of uncertainty \+ Innovation \+ Sweating the details and delivering results \+ Communicating and managing complexity \+ Working across functions/disciplines \+ Engaging and motivating others \+ Being a team builder/team player Requirements: \+ 2 years in a highly analytical or quantitative function \+ Being a strategic thinker, analytical, and detail oriented -- and having excellent problem-solving skills and a strong work ethic. Being a motivated self-starter, an evangelist for a data-driven culture, and desiring a deep understanding of customer needs. \+ Ability and willingness to learn structured and unstructured data systems \+ Experience in developing business requirements for instrumentation with Google Analytics; ability to instrument in Google Tag Manager a plus \+ Proficiency in effective report/dashboard design and standards \+ Familiarity with data preparation, processing, classification, and forecasting \+ Familiarity with the software product lifecycle \+ Ability to write SQL and create data visualizations \+ Experience with Amazon S3, Redshift, Athena, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, Google Big Query, Tableau, or JavaScript, are big pluses! \+ A Bachelor’s degree or advanced degree in a technical, business, or math- based field \+ Experience interacting with individuals at all levels, good time management, and solid communication skills. \+ Proven leadership ability to influence and inspire people indirectly, lead by example, and engage and effectively build multidisciplinary alliances \+ Ability to do some travel for planning and team meetings (20%) and frequently use web-based remote video and project collaboration tools NOTE: MUST be fully authorized to work in the U.S. No OPTs, visa sponsorship, visa transfers or future green card sponsorships. Gravie is seeking a dynamic analyst to own the analysis and tools underlying Gravie’s insurance product solutions. This role will drive quantitative and qualitative analysis central to the development and operation of Gravie’s insurance products. This role also provides critical analytical and operational support to Gravie’s sales operations team and will have direct impact on the success of Gravie’s sales function. YOU WILL: Design and perform diverse quantitative and qualitative analyses to support new insurance product development, operation and growth of existing products, and sales financial analysis for new and current customers. Collaborate closely with others on your team and on other teams across the company to gather requirements, understand data structures, and synthesize information to deliver analyses that answer complex questions. Operate actuarial pricing manuals and integrate their results into analyses, tools, and systems used across the company. Own the maintenance and enhancement of existing tools and models that are core to Gravie’s insurance product and sales operations functions. You will develop new tools as well, as needs arise. Transform sometimes-complex and large datasets into a usable format that can be used in conjunction with existing tools to show meaningful results. Make assumptions and judgment calls in completing analyses, based on your learned knowledge of the health insurance and other products Gravie sells. Draw upon your analytical, creative, and problem solving skills to translate business needs into an actionable plan to get results – and then execute upon that plan. YOU BRING: Bachelor's degree from college or university Very strong analytical aptitude and problem solving skills Quantitative proficiency, with some mathematical and statistical work experience and/or coursework Excellent Excel skills, with ability to manipulate large and complex datasets and build tools within Excel, for use by other teams Excellent attention to detail Strong verbal and written communication skills Habits of excellent organization, time management, and responsiveness A flexible attitude and ability to work independently with limited direction An appetite for learning and quickly putting what you learn into practice Demonstrated commitment to core Gravie competencies of being authentic, curious, creative, and results oriented EXTRA CREDIT: Master's Degree in math Background, or at least interest, in health insurance or healthcare Experience with business intelligence tools and/or CRM Knowledge of SQL

Bind rewired health benefits to be on-demand. This means people are covered for what they need and have the flexibility to add more coverage if or when they need it. The Bind plan puts the power in people's hands, where it belongs, and allows them to design their health benefits coverage on-the-go, based on their life and needs. Summary: At Verscend, we are custodians of data for our clients. This requires efficient processes to manage data implementations, data production, data quality and data security. The Data Analysis function provides insight into different aspects of the data operations function right from raw data files, to the quality of data in the deliverables. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in relevant field such as Health Science, Computer Science, Business, or equivalent experience. At least 2 years’ experience with data analysis. Strong data manipulation skills using database and spreadsheet applications. Knowledge of database applications, including extraction and querying skills. 2+ years’ experience within the Healthcare or Insurance space in a Data Warehouse operations organization. Strong knowledge of healthcare enrollment, medical claims, and drug claims data required. Additional knowledge of non-traditional data types (health & wellness, workforce productivity, and EMR) preferred. Ability to use SQL (TOAD, SQL Tools) and other data tools to analyze diverse data sets. · Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritize projects to meet scheduled deadlines. Ability to analyze raw data and disseminate results, with ability to think logically and process sequentially with a high level of detailed accuracy. · Ability to work well independently or in a team environment. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, including PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Outlook and Project. Principal Responsibilities and Essential Duties : Data Management and Data Quality Host and facilitate discussions with Healthcare data carriers to (1) manage data intake, and (2) ensure all client data requirements are discussed and confirmed. Document meeting discussions and obtain sign off from the client and carriers. Perform data quality checks verifying that data provided is consistent with the requirements to build Healthcare Data Warehouse. Write data transformation specifications to load source data into target data warehouse tables. Work with the database programmers to perform quality checks on the reformatted coding; ensure data is complete while and making modifications as necessary to transform the raw data into table layouts. Data Analysis Perform data analysis, data mining and identify root cause of issues using SQL. Assist the Engineering/Tools team with new business requirements and help them with Functional Specifications. Assist in the conversion of internal processes from manual to automated through coding and programming.

The position reports to the Analytics Manager and works closely with other colleagues in CLA Office of Application Development (OAD) and CLA Administration, and also with other members of the University community. The position works with the OAD team and other members of collegiate administration to perform analysis projects and maintain information systems supporting management and policy decisions for a wide range of areas -- including student recruitment, admissions, financial aid, process assessment, enrollment management, student services, financial systems, human resources, retention/graduation, and donor relations. CLA’s departments and administrative units depend on the analytic staff of the college to provide reliable data, insightful analysis, and quick responses. Duties/Responsibilities Perform ad-hoc analyses and produce reports, publications, and other output (60%) Under the direction of the Analytics Manager, conduct analyses and produce data, reports, presentations, and electronic content to disseminate findings. Communicate results of analyses to appropriate audiences. Respond to internal data requests from CLA Undergraduate Education, CLA administrators, departments, faculty, and staff. Respond to external data requests from University of Minnesota administrators, surveys, and public inquiries. Develop, implement, and maintain data collections and information systems (30%) Under the direction of the Analytics Manager, assist in the further development, implementation, and maintenance of collegiate information systems. Develop interactive reports in Tableau for the CLA Reporting & Analytics reports hub (CLARA). Assist in stewardship of OAD’s query repository, including the maintenance of query definitions, parameters, logic, validation, and documentation. Assist in the creation of new information systems in areas such as student recruitment, enrollment, financial aid, student services, retention/graduation, and donor relations. Information and communications coordination (10%): Work as first contact for incoming project requests to CLA DSS, weighing incoming tasks against existing workloads, triaging assignments and liaising with our partners. Represent the unit at collegiate administrator meetings, collegiate committees and task forces, University-wide committees, and to external partners and agencies. Coordinate the CLA communications outreach calendar with University partners. Provide support and consultation to CLA Administration as needed, e.g., writing reports, data analysis, etc. Stay current in developments in the field. Develop and maintain liaisons with other University staff and outside organizations. About the Department This position works for the Office of Undergraduate Education within the College of Liberal Arts (CLA) at the University of Minnesota-Twin Cities, a premier land-grant research university committed to excellence and student success. CLA spans the arts, humanities, and social sciences and prepares students to be independent and original thinkers, to be innovators in their chosen fields, to create meaning in their life’s work, and to become productive citizens and leaders in their communities and the world. CLA is the largest college in the University of Minnesota, with approximately 500 faculty, 800 staff positions, 14,000 undergraduate and 1,600 graduate students across 31 academic units. CLA Undergraduate Education oversees curriculum, instruction, advising, recruitment, scholarships, diversity, access, student support services, student research opportunities, internships, career services, and outreach. Each year the College welcomes 2,450 new first-year undergraduate students and nearly the same number of transfer students. Nestlé Health Science (NHSc) is a company on a mission and on the move, motivated by the opportunity to forge a major therapeutic role for nutrition in the management of health and establish a new industry between food and pharmaceuticals. The two elements of the equation are simple; societies are ageing and age and lifestyle related diseases are spiraling. Needs are growing for safe, effective and cost-effective solutions. At the same time, scientific understanding of health, disease and the potential of nutrition – as an integral part of managing health and disease – is growing. Nestlé Health Science , a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Nestlé Group, was created in 2011 to be a leader in these developments and make things happen. We have over 3,000 employees around the world with a wide mix of capabilities – from bio-medical engineers to regulatory specialists, medical delegates (sales force) and health economic experts that reflect our dynamism and intent to create. The Pricing Execution Analysts are change agents, problem solvers and strong communicators who use data and technology to help our business improve. At Nestlé Health Science, you will have a variety of duties including loading customer pricing into the system, reconciling pricing, developing various types of reports, helping managers define a strategy for improving processes and systems, and driving or assisting in implementing those improvements. This position will work with other Business Operations teams, as well as collaborating with many other internal and external business partners. Primary Responsibilities: Uploading Pricing into Systems Upload agreements, terms and conditions into the system. This includes pricing, rebates, admin fees and allowances. Create, renew, extend and maintain agreements, and terms and conditions. Update GDSN database timely with any changes and point person for NHS GDSN. Troubleshoot and identify root causes of pricing discrepancies, and develop solutions. Document issues that result in pricing discrepancies; advise on pricing discrepancies concerns and/or problems that need to be resolved or escalate appropriately. Conduct QA on agreements loaded into systems. Reporting Design, develop, and maintain ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions. Track issues with reports, including agreement terms entered in systems, quality problems, and processing errors. Create job aids, process flows, external-facing forms and documents, and other type of department knowledge articles. Create reporting that will review agreement terms entered into the system against the contract log and/or work with Contract Analyst for accuracy. Process / System Improvement Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, data accuracy, data completeness, validation, and documentation. Identify and document opportunities for process improvement. Recommend controls for identifying issues and creating improved processes/procedures Other Duties Performs other duties and special projects as assigned and directed.. Qualifications EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS 3-5 years of relevant job experience. 4 year degree in business, management or related. Ability to work independently, with little or no direction. Think strategically, recognizing the inputs and outputs of systems and business processes. Strong analytical skills; ability to make data-driven decisions. Proven problem solver who can detect problems - recommend and implement solutions. High level of attention of detail with effectively organization skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills, with a focus on customer service. Working knowledge of SAP and SAP reporting tools, such as Business Objects and BW environments. Ability to work well in a diverse team and a cross-functional environment. Self-motivated, works quickly and efficiently on multiple tasks. Ability to work effectively in a team environment. The Nestlé Companies are equal employment and affirmative action employers and looking for diversity in qualified candidates for employment.

The successful candidate will be able to focus on data quality to ensure the accuracy of reports and dashboards, as well as work through integration challenges when dealing with different data sources, formats and conventions. Primary aspects of the job are: 1\. Working with internal production systems to extract data necessary to report on KPI's and produce operational dashboards. 2\. Working with data extracted for our products to support our customers success team with analyses of individual customer success stories, ROI and future opportunities. 3\. Working with historical consumer activity and demographic data to identify behavioral trends and classifications. 4\. Assist internal users with interpretation of reported data, and provide general support for data integration needs across the organization. Experience in the health care industry is desirable. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES 1\. Produce high quality reports and analytical dashboards, using existing data visualization and reporting tools. 2\. Contribute to and enable a data-driven culture and decision making process. 3\. Be a self-motivated team member who is willing to identify and respond to needs. 4\. Respond to requests from various departments regarding data integration and reporting needs. 7\. Ability to work in small collaborative teams with minimal supervision. 8\. Maintain and improve technical skills over time, taking advantage of new technologies and methodologies when appropriate. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/KNOWLEDGE 4-Year Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field 2 + years of data reporting or analytics experience Experience with multiple analytics software packages EO/AA

This role will consist of: Proactively partnering with analysts, developers and solution architects to implement the analytics scripts needed Maintaining internal databases, as well as connecting to and maintaining external data sources that are used in client-facing dynamic reports (Tableau, Excel, Google Data Studio among others) Testing and managing various database sources from site, first- and third- party, and ad hoc pulls; ensuring proper functionality and integrity of the data Connecting to and maintaining various data sources to build dynamic reporting dashboards, managing a central database (received from multiple sources) that would allow for a multitude of client facing reports You’d be a good fit if you: Have demonstrated proficiency using database management platforms and software (MySQL, R, Python, Tableau or others considered) and experience in data management, data administration, and data blends and joins across multiple sources Have in-depth MS SQL experience a plus Have site and digital analysis skills using various programs (Google Analytics, Adobe Omniture, or others) strongly preferred Possess the ability to make numbers and data beautiful (Tableau, Excel, Google Data Studio preferred) Have prior experience in web tagging (Google Tag Manager or others) or website data and event management preferred Possess strong data, analytic, and quantitative skills. Are detail-oriented Have effective communication skills Thrive on collaboration and work well with others within the analytics team as well as cross-departmental peers Can balance multiple priorities and time management with internal and client-driven deadlines Are naturally curious and driven about data and insights Have or currently finishing up your BA/BS in Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics, mathematics or related field Are living in or near the Minneapolis/St. Paul area - this is an on-site internship Details Start Date: 9/4/18 End Date: 12/15/18 Hours: We are flexible in this area. Anywhere between 15-40 hours a week Three Deep Marketing Core Values Our Core Values are Team First, Passionate, Problem Solver and Accountability _We aim to surround ourselves with employees who exemplify our core values and avoid hiring those who do not. Whether you are new to Three Deep or have been an employee for years, you are expected to represent these core values each and every day._ Team First Know your role and do it really, really well; then lock arms with your team and drive outstanding business results. Take a team first, me second approach to doing business – find a way to get what you need, respectfully. Easy to work with, have a good sense of humor, and positive attitude. This position is based in Sioux Falls, SD 911 call records. Crime reports. Jail booking information. Evidence logs. More and more agencies are switching to Zuercher Software to track this kind of data. And when they do, Zuercher Technologies’ Data Conversion Analysts make sure they have immediate access to the wealth of legacy data they’ve built up, right at their fingertips in their new Zuercher system, from the moment they switch it on. And that’s important work when you’re dealing with mission-critical data. Our Data Conversion Analysts take pride in knowing that their work is a key factor in making our customers’ new systems useful to them right from the start. That when someone calls 911, the dispatcher will be notified of prior incidents at the caller’s address. That investigators will still have access to the years of case reports that will help them see connections between related crimes. Thanks to our Data Conversion Analysts, our customers spend less time hunting for records and more time protecting and serving. Sound like a cool way to use your data skills for good? We’d love to have you join us. Here's an overview of the tasks and responsibilities: Work collaboratively with customer agencies undergoing Zuercher software implementation to obtain data from their legacy system, understand what it means and how it is used, and determine how best to translate it into their Zuercher system Analyze legacy data to estimate / benchmark project scope and length Develop scripts to load legacy data into conversion tools and convert data into Zuercher software Develop and maintain an understanding of Zuercher software including functionality and database schema; use this knowledge to make informed decisions regarding data mapping and to review data within target system Communicate with customer agencies throughout implementation projects to clarify questions that arise regarding data mapping, demonstrate converted data in target system, understand any modifications needed, and verify results of modifications Manipulate and load data such as code tables from secondary additional sources to assist in configuration of agencies’ Zuercher systems Assist in running final data conversion at time of system go-live Communicate proactively with supervisor and project manager regarding project progress and any project risks or issues that arise Create and maintain documentation for data conversion processes; seek out process improvements Interested? Here's what we need from you: Experience with SQL and at least one RDBMS Knowledge of ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) processes Ability to learn new applications and processes quickly Passion for technology; eager to learn new tools and technologies Strong customer-facing skills and personal interaction/interpersonal skills Ability to adapt quickly to changing business and customer needs, maintaining a high degree of flexibility Self-motivated; able to work independently Superb attention to detail Superior time-management capabilities and ability to complete projects on deadline Ability to travel 25% Able to work out of the Zuercher corporate office in Sioux Falls, SD or Marlborough, MA Bonus points for: Previous experience performing data conversion, data migration, ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) Proficiency with at least one programming language, preferably Python Associate’s or bachelor’s degree in a technology-related field What we offer in return for all your great skills: Competitive salary with annual bonus program 401K with employer match Unlimited PTO plus 10 holidays Medical, dental, vision insurance Flex Spending Accounts Health Savings Account with employer contribution Employee discounts (movies, gym, and more) Tuition reimbursement Annual onsite flu shots (Employer Paid) Casual work environment Zuercher is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer: Minority/Female/Disability/Veterans/Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity

Job Description At Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Enterprise Finance & Information Technology offers technology and services that exceed Wells Fargo customers’ expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. We interact with customers more than 12 billion times a year through in-store, online, ATM, and telephone transactions. We impact customers directly, through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through our business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers’ financial needs. We provide a competitive advantage for the company through excellence in fundamentals, integrated partnerships, and our talented and engaged team members. Responsible for very complex partner assignments to identify and define strategic business issues that require analyses and translates this information into insight, knowledge and understanding of the business and the industry. This position will require occasional off hours support (outside of 8:00AM and 5:00PM in time zone of residence) for meetings with offshore resources or critical application support. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women. Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Validus Re is a leading global multi-line reinsurance group founded in 2005. In addition, we provide exceptional service and commitment to our clients and their communities. Currently, we have an outstanding opportunity to work in our Minneapolis office for a Catastrophe Risk Analyst to handle the following: Responsibilities: Prepare raw and edited insurance company policy data or aggregates for use in industry catastrophe models (AIR, RMS) for reinsurance contract pricing in Validus proprietary software. Model the probability distributions of the pre-cat results using vendor cat models in conjunction with Validus proprietary software. Assess data quality/accuracy of reinsurance submissions. Analyze how the distribution of results and relevant risk measures change after application of reinsurance contract terms and discuss with treaty underwriters. Communicate analysis results to colleagues and interpreting potential impact to Validus reinsurance portfolio. Assist management with reports related to catastrophe modeling data. Utilize domain knowledge of worldwide insurance markets for comparison of individual cedant data to industry regions and lines of business profiles. Track and run simulations against portfolio for replication of potential losses from live catastrophic events. Preferred Qualifications: Understanding and/or working knowledge of industry catastrophe modeling. Careers that Change Lives The Cardiac and Vascular Group brings all of our cardiac and vascular businesses together into one cross-functional, collaborative operating unit to employ the full breadth of our talent, technologies, products, services, and solutions to address the needs of customers and patients across the globe. Cardiac Arrhythmia and Heart Failure (CRHF) offers devices and therapies to treat abnormal heart rhythms, as well as cardiac diagnostic and monitoring solutions. A Day in the Life The Clinical Portfolio Data Analyst ensures the accuracy of the Clinical Research portfolio/program data and provides analysis and reporting services for the Cardiac Arrhythmia and Heart Failure Clinical Portfolio Management Office (PMO) and its stakeholders. In this role, you will work closely with key Clinical Research stakeholders in ensuring program data quality and accuracy. You will produce and analyze weekly, monthly and ad-hoc portfolio and program reports, design and build program dashboards, perform data manipulation, and support application configuration. CS WORKFORCE ANALYST Position Description This position is responsible to oversee the Workforce Management (WFM) platform utilized for forecasting and scheduling in the customer services center. Monitor and report call center operational and performance standards. Communicate staffing and training needs for member services, provider assistance center, service team and transportation teams. Evaluate and develop opportunities to improve service center performance and efficiency. Lead in the effort of updating and entering statistical data into Workforce Management, ensuring adequate coverage by scheduling breaks and lunches, schedule maintenance, including adjusting thresholds and IS collaboration. Review and respond to time off requests, off phone activities, meetings and shift changes based on business needs. Collaborate with supervisors on real-time monitoring of the ACD and schedule adherence to maximize customer availability. Maintain daily, weekly and monthly reporting of call center service levels. Reporting and tracking vendor invoices and send off timely for payment processing. Communicate service impacts to call center leadership this includes service level impacts, analyze staffing and training needs and make recommendations. Assist with forecasting while acting as the main scheduler. Responsibilities include updating and entering statistical info into WFM tool. Collaborate and follow up with IS on open help desk tickets and drive to desired resolution. Responsible for maintenance of recordings: greetings, prompts and hold messages. Other projects and duties as assigned. Education High school diploma or equivalent. Associates degree preferred. Required Experience Knowledge of multi skill call center environment. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft office products: Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Outlook. Preferred Experience Expertise and understanding of CISCO ACD. Knowledge with IVR systems. Workforce Management scheduling software (forecasting and scheduling) THE UCARE DIFFERENCE UCare is proud to be a recognized Star Tribune Top Workplace for the 9th consecutive year. As a part of our collaborative team, you'll experience the rewards that come with helping others and seeing the positive results of your hard work. We value and respect each individual's ideas and contributions, and give you the freedom to grow both personally and professionally. We are centrally located, and offer onsite education, equipment and wellness resources, a myriad of volunteer activities, and a number of other rewards. If you're looking for a welcoming environment that celebrates what you have to offer, helps you build on your strengths, and gives you the opportunity to truly make a difference, we invite you to apply. As an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, we welcome and employ a diverse employee group committed to meeting the needs of UCare, our members, and the communities we serve.

Description Cox Communications is looking for an expert in reporting, analysis, and metrics with a working knowledge of advanced analytical techniques. Typically assigned to larger, highly complex projects requiring independent decision- making. Partners with cross-functional teams and stakeholders on ideas and solutions that impact operational results. In addition to supporting analytics projects, the Regional Analyst IIs will support regional ad hoc reporting as requested, such as “what-if” modeling. Primary Responsibilities and Essential Functions: Strong communication capability, leading resources on multiple projects across the Analytics team through both setting a good example and establishing open channels of dialog Provides and conducts analytic efforts to support business operations, which may include the development of analytical tools and numerical models of complex operations systems and processes Creates executive dashboards and presentations in support of department or business operations Supports Regional ad-hoc requests, diving into Regional variation and isolating drivers of best/worst-in-class performance Identifies, researches, and resolves discrepancies in core reports/dashboards Interprets operational requirements for inclusion in studies and analyses Provides recommendations for operational efficiencies and process improvements and assists in policy development to support change initiatives May write code to automate reports and templates and consolidate data into reports Conducts business impact analyses through all stages: concept formulation, definition of metrics, determination of appropriate statistical methodology, research evaluation, and final research report Facilitates meetings and presentations to Regional leadership Qualifications Minimum: 4 or more years of experience required in related field (i.e. Applied Research, Analytics, etc.) or an advanced degree in a relevant field (i.e. Engineering, Math, Analytics, Computer Science, etc…) Strong data analytic skill and ability to leverage statistical/database software (e.g. SQL/R/Python/etc…) Advanced knowledge of statistics. AppZen has developed the world’s first artificial intelligence (AI) solution for business process automation. AppZen’s AI for business solutions uses patent-pending Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision and machine learning algorithms to analyze data and automate functions. Our technology is used to automate business processes for both small and large enterprises, including fortune 50 organizations. The data science-based technology automatically detects accidental and intentional fraud, providing real-time compliance to IRS rules, FCPA regulations, and general company policies. Passionate about data and want to ensure the best customer experience? We are looking for people who can ensure success with our fast growing list of Fortune 50 customers. This position’s primary focus is analyzing customers data and working with our Implementation, Customer Success and Engineering teams to ensure customers are configured for success. You want to help our customers get the most out of AppZen’s audit solution and get joy out of watching a customer really succeed. You have GREAT communication skills and know how to get the message across. You have a finely tuned sense of urgency, you know when you can fix something, and when and how to ask for help. Responsibilities Analyzing customers data to identify areas of improvement within their configuration. Presenting data insights and potential solutions to teams within the Customer Success org. Working cross functionally to Identify and provide solutions to internal business process issues that impact the customer experience. Communicate suggested product improvements to the development team. Must-Haves: Humble and Friendly personality with an open and honest communication style. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Ability to understand our business applications quickly with little hands on training. Bonus Points: Working understanding of fraud and compliance

_Are you_ _passionate_ _about improving the quality of healthcare?_ _Are you_ _interested_ _in exploring a rapidly expanding universe of clinical data?_ _Are you ready to_ _leverage your talents_ _to make healthcare better for everyone?_ _Are you_ _fascinated_ _by the growing field of_ _data science_ _?_ Then join the new _Data Science & Advanced Analytics_ team at Health Services Advisory Group (HSAG) that is transforming the delivery of healthcare in the United States! HSAG has been a pioneer in the field of healthcare quality improvement for over three decades, serving approximately: 25 percent of the nation’s Medicare population 46 percent of the nation’s Medicaid population 20 percent of the nation’s dialysis population HSAG is nationally recognized as an industry leader in the areas of data analysis, measure development, and patient satisfaction surveys. We are in search of talented individuals that are interested in a career in analytics as an Analyst in HSAG’s Data Science & Advanced Analytics division. Together we can spread positive change to make healthcare better. UNIQUE BENEFITS The Analyst also benefits from HSAG’s desire to grow its staff into the future leaders of healthcare quality improvement in the nation. New HSAG analysts are provided formal training in statistics, clinical epidemiology, SAS, healthcare data, and an assortment of healthcare-related topics. HSAG offers: A comfortable work-life balance, including half-day Fridays and flexible work schedules. Three weeks of paid time off and 13 company-paid holidays where staff leave two hours early prior to each holiday just to get a “jump start” on holiday festivities. HSAG offers a competitive benefit package which includes, medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) and an employee stock ownership plan. DESCRIPTION The Analyst is a key contributor to cutting edge analytic work that spans the broad spectrum of healthcare data projects at HSAG. Driven by intellectual curiosity and a passion for healthcare quality, the Analyst develops and executes innovative analytic plans that are intended to provide healthcare decision and policy makers with the necessary information to transform healthcare. The Analyst will also assist in designing a wide array of analytic studies and participate in all phases of the research design process. The Analyst will have at his or her fingertips a wide array of data types to facilitate data exploration, including: survey case review medical and prescription drug claims eligibility clinical electronic health record operational Details regarding potential project assignments will be discussed with potential candidates during the interview process. ESSENTIAL COMPETENCIES, DUTIES, AND RESPONSIBILITIES Serve as an integral part of HSAG Data Science & Advanced Analytics division. Understand primary types of healthcare data and methods for approaching data assessments. Evaluate a wide array of data types. Conduct and interpret analyses, develop appropriate statistical models, manipulate complex databases, and track and evaluate patterns of care and outcomes. Perform data validation, conduct analysis plans, and cross reference data. Attend and participates in team training meetings. Present and communicate project results to nonanalytic staff members and customers. Represent HSAG in a professional manner at all times. JOB REQUIREMENTS EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE Bachelor’s degree in public health, related social science, business, economics, math, statistics, or another quantitative discipline. Master’s degree preferred. OTHER QUALIFICATIONS Knowledge of statistical programming in SAS. SAS certification preferred. Experience with relational databases, SQL, and other reporting tools. Experience working with healthcare data is preferred. Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Access. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to handle several projects simultaneously and work with multiple teams. WORK ENVIRONMENT The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current position, management reserves the right to revise the position or to require that other or different tasks be performed when circumstances change (e.g., emergencies, changes in personnel, work load, rush jobs requiring non-regular work hours, or technological developments). Job Title: Hazardous Material Inventory Service Data Entry/Analyst
Description: This position is responsible for all HMIS functions, which includes site inventory visits (10% field / 90% office), SDS (Safety Data Sheet) acquisition and recordkeeping, data entry, data analysis, regulatory compliance documentation development, applicable fire department and Tier II reporting, and basic AutoCAD draft work. This position assists Envirosure in maintaining active and up-to-date client inventory, map, and associated files. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Research: Environmental, health, and safety regulations; Material Safety Data Sheets Data Entry: Input data into Access database; Generate reports from data. Analysis: Analyze data reports against environmental, health and safety regulations; develop/write/review summary reports based upon analysis results. Reporting: Develop and/or update Fire Department HMIS and HMMP reports as well as annual Tier II Reporting. Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Must have experience in a professional office environment. Must exhibit very capable written and verbal communication skills, and have good organizational skills. Must exhibit leadership qualities necessary to provide an atmosphere of teamwork within departments, and throughout the company. Must have a strong team mentality yet autonomous work style, and understand their function within the production lines. Education and Experience: This position requires a High School Diploma or the equivalent (GED) and a minimum of 0.5 years experience in a related (data entry) field. Preference given to a candidate with a Bachelor of Science or other advanced degree in Environmental Health and Safety, Chemistry, Geology, or similar speciality, and experience in the EHS field is desired. Language Skills: Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. Mathematical Skills: Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry. Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations. Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Database Management systems; Contact Management systems; Spreadsheet software; E-mail; and Word Processing software. Job Type: Full-time Salary: $31,000.00 to $36,000.00 /year Job Location: Tempe, AZ 85282 Email your resume to careers “at” envirosure.com

Within GSR, the Distribution team is responsible for managing our distribution partners, Air/Hotel/Ground content and many other strategic initiatives. This role will play a vital role in supporting our various initiatives and negotiations. We are looking for a candidate who can bring strong capabilities in data analytics and visualization to drive actionable insights and impactful recommendations to optimize negotiations, revenue and performance. The Distribution Intelligence Analyst will also have a strong interest in understanding key business processes, commercial implications and a passion for developing new predictive analytics utilizing new data sources and big data. Distribution, Airlines, hospitality, travel and tourism background will be a plus. Primary Responsibilities Include: Develop advanced analytics methodologies to provide senior management on key performance metrics and predictive insights that will enable strategic business decisions Communicate with stakeholders across global markets to understand revenue optimization and business performance related questions. Support strategic and operational initiatives to produce effective reporting and actionable insights. Translate business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out data mining, analysis, visualization and presentation. Collaborate with database developers globally to streamline data sources to ensure consistency in the data used to support regular and ad hoc reporting and analysis Coordinate between database development and business teams such as Revenue Management and Supplier Optimization teams to align and enhance the understanding data and analytics capabilities Drive big data and predictive analytics development Qualifications Include: Insight/Data/BI or MI Analyst with 1-2 year experience, or graduate with a relevant business/analytical degree Advanced MS skills (Excel/Access/VBA/PowerPoint) is essential Experience using with a variety of BI, reporting and visualization tools (such as MS Power BI, IBM Cognos BI Suite, SSAS, SSRS, SSIS, Tableau, Micro Strategy) Understanding of database development in SQL, ETL and query optimization High proficiency with structuring strategic analysis using appropriate statistical modeling, research techniques and visual presentations to support points of view Strong stakeholder engagement skills including communications, time management and prioritization skills Ability to understand business processes and commercial implications to make strategic recommendations (LI-YH1) Location United States>Arizona>Phoenix It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds. Ashton Tiffany, LLC, has been making risk management fun (seriously) since 1995. For 20 years and counting, we’ve helped our clients reduce risk—and reduce the cost of it. Our specialty areas include insurance pool administration, self-insurance services, and outsourced risk management programs. That’s what we do, but the how is just as important to us. We’re committed to active listening, rigorous fundamentals, innovative thinking, and – unusually, in this business – having a good time at work. Ashton Tiffany has approximately 90 employees in its central Phoenix office. We were named one of Phoenix’s 10 best places to work by the Business Journal for the past ten years, and one of AZCentral.com’s Top Companies to Work For in Arizona in 2015, 2016, and 2017. Our company is driven by four core values: a fun and professional culture, operational excellence, financial strength, and an outstanding reputation. That’s _FOFO_ to us. We are currently looking for a full-time Data Analyst to join our team. This is a permanent, full-time postion (not a contract). This position will work closely with the Claims Director in performing assigned job duties and tasks. Here’s what you’d be doing: data mapping and conversion of Risk Management Information System (RMIS) designing, implementing and maintaining electronic data interfaces maintaining and analyzing data of existing programs analyzing, reconciling and preparing loss data, charts and graphs preparing reports for regulatory filings preparing loss data for internal staff, clients, reinsurers and brokers

ARIZONA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH SERVICES 150 N. 18th Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85007 “ _Promoting_ ___Health and Wellness for all Arizonans”_ is the motto of the Arizona Department of Health Services (ADHS). ADHS promotes and protects the health of Arizona’s children and adults and sets the standard for personal and community health through direct care, science, public policy and leadership. ADHS is an award winning, nationally recognized department and is one of the largest in Arizona State Government with a budget of 1.5 billion dollars and workforce of approximately 1550 employees. Visit our website at http://www.azdhs.gov Healthcare Data Analyst Public Health Licensing Open until filled JOB SUMMARY The Division of Public Health Licensing is looking for a motivated and dedicated individual to join our team! The Healthcare Data Analyst serves as the Senior analyst in the Office of Data and Quality Improvement in the Division of Licensing and oversees data management and administrative maintenance of all systems. As the senior analyst and under the direction of Bureau Chief, is responsible for advanced analysis in performance tracking and quality standard reporting for the improvement of licensing procedures including capturing key metrics, implementing new technologies and structural redesign. This position will regularly collaborate with Information Technology (IT) staff and assist in developing highly complex technical data systems and ensure they are operational by participating in software development life cycle projects including quality assurance testing. All Arizona State employees operate within the Arizona Management System (AMS), an intentional, results-driven approach for doing the work of state government whereby every employee reflects on performance, reduces waste, and commits to continuous improvement with sustainable progress. Through AMS, every state employee seeks to understand customer needs, identify problems, improve processes, and measure results. State employees are highly engaged, collaborative and embrace a culture of public service. Responsibilities include: – Developing and maintaining data systems and other automation strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality including BI tools – Managing collection, interpreting and analyzing of data to address public health concerns and provide clear, accurate and value-added reports – Identifying and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets – Filtering and "cleaning" data, and reviewing reports, trends and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems while improving data quality – Designing, manipulating, and using databases for analysis of health problems to assess the potential public health impact – Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems – Locating and defining new process improvement opportunities including participation in software development efforts – Providing consultative services on large and difficult programs or projects and serves as an informatics support to all Division bureaus – Analyzing epidemiologic investigation data, adapts or combines a variety of existing statistical methods to fulfill specific project needs – Working closely with management to prioritize business and information needs – Providing scientific advice and technical assistance to staff and outside partners – Conducting oral presentations to diverse audiences – Researching and responding to requests for information, data and other special reports from program management, other state agencies, providers and general public, and prepare communication tools to disseminate information to providers and public Requirements include: Public Health Principles that provide the employee with the program development, planning and evaluation skills necessary to successfully create, implement and assess the impact of licensing data systems Data mining and evaluation methodologies, including format design, project criteria and requirements, data compilation, relevancy and usage Leadership and systems thinking that allow the employee to ensure programs and policies work well together with other facets of public health to promote positive health outcomes Monitor program goals and objectives effectively and adjust program policies and actives as needed Collaborate with staff on data coding problems and assist in developing means to correct problems Communicate effectively in both written and verbal formats and provide on-going consultation and technical assistance in an efficient and effective manner Develops ad-hoc reports as necessary Interpret state and federal regulatory/management laws, rules and guidance Support a diverse multi-cultural workforce that reflects the community, promotes equal opportunity at all levels of public employment, and creates an inclusive work environment that enables all individuals to perform to their fullest potential free from discrimination Preferred Qualifications: Masters of public health in Epidemiology and three years of professional experience in applied public health epidemiology Bachelors in public health or a science-related field and five years of experience in applied public health epidemiology Ideal candidate will have experience working with the different levels of US health care system and public health system, and working with design development, data mining and segmentation techniques Knowledge of statistics, programming languages (i.e. SQL) and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (i.e. SAS) Benefits The State of Arizona provides an excellent comprehensive benefits package including: Affordable medical, dental, life, and short-term disability insurance plans Top-ranked retirement and long-term disability plans Accrued vacation pay and sick days 10 paid holidays per year Deferred compensation plan Credit union membership Wellness plans Employment Requirements Requires possession of and ability to retain a current, valid state-issued driver’s license appropriate to the assignment. Employees who drive on state business are subject to driver’s license checks, must maintain acceptable driving records and must complete any driver training (See Arizona Administrative Code R2-10-207.12). Arizona State Government is an EOE/ADA Reasonable Accommodation Employer. All newly hired employees will be subject to E-Verify Employment Eligibility Verification. Job Description At Wells Fargo, we have one goal: to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them achieve their dreams. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Enterprise Finance & Information Technology offers technology and services that exceed Wells Fargo customers’ expectations and directly enable them to succeed financially. We interact with customers more than 12 billion times a year through in-store, online, ATM, and telephone transactions. We impact customers directly, through systems availability and security, as well as indirectly, through our business partners who offer and deliver a myriad of products and services that meet customers’ financial needs. We provide a competitive advantage for the company through excellence in fundamentals, integrated partnerships, and our talented and engaged team members. Responsible for very complex partner assignments to identify and define strategic business issues that require analyses and translates this information into insight, knowledge and understanding of the business and the industry. Consults and performs very complex analyses/ analysis design involving data mining from multiple sources and/or predictive modeling, regression/multivariate, financial, comparative analysis, customer/demographic analysis, etc. Analytics involved generally span multiple functional areas/business lines/data sources. Responsibilities also include identifying opportunities for additional statistical models and/or creating sophisticated computer modeling approaches to analyze and forecast business performance; participating in and/or leading management information capabilities development work; interpreting and presenting results of analyses and recommendations to senior management. Ensures adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies. Data involved may be very large, structured or unstructured, and from multiple sources. To a certain degree, may be involved directly or indirectly in the technical build-out and/or support of databases, query tools, reporting tools, BI tools, dashboards, etc that enable analysis, modeling, and/or data visualization. Leads project/virtual teams & mentors lower level staff. This position will require occasional domestic travel not to exceed 25%. This position will require occasional off hours support (outside of 8:00AM and 5:00PM in time zone of residence) for meetings with offshore resources or critical application support. Required Qualifications 6+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling; or a Masters degree or higher in a quantitative field such as applied math, statistics, engineering, physics, accounting, finance, economics, econometrics, computer sciences, or business/social and behavioral sciences with a quantitative emphasis and 4+ years of experience in one or a combination of the following: reporting, analytics, or modeling 5+ years of data analysis experience 3+ years of data collection and reporting experience 3+ years of data warehouse experience 3+ years of database experience Desired Qualifications Extensive knowledge and understanding of research and analysis Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills Other Desired Qualifications The successful candidate has the capability, with little or no direction, to dissect a data set to determine patterns, anomalies, and meaning. Disclaimer All offers for employment with Wells Fargo are contingent upon the candidate having successfully completed a criminal background check. Wells Fargo will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state and Federal law, including Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. Relevant military experience is considered for veterans and transitioning service men and women. Wells Fargo is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

SPINS, a Chicago-based SaaS company, is seeking a Client Data Analyst to join our team based in Phoenix, AZ (85054). By leveraging SPINS’ industry-leading proprietary data and analytics, our technology enables deeper, more engaged relationships between Retailers, Brands and Consumers through our platform, web, and mobile products. WHO ARE WE? We eat collaboration and curiosity for breakfast We communicate quickly and succinctly We believe in roles instead of jobs We take initiative independently and hurdle challenges together We discuss, debate, decide and do with the same rapidity as we iterate our platform We are a talent ecosystem whose health is predicated on each individual’s ability to support every other individual’s success WHO ARE YOU? Someone who begins a project with data and ends with data Someone energetic, empathic and earnest Someone that refuses to give up when the path isn’t paved Someone that consistently delivers quality work on schedule Someone who would rather build the right tool to do the job than wait until they’re handed one A creative thinker as adept at looking at the Big Picture as they are at the details WHAT DO WE NEED? Are you passionate about using data to support the development of growth stories for retailers? Do you have a desire to move into the fast-growing Health & Wellness space by working closely with a rapidly evolving retailer spanning departments from food and beverage to body care and vitamins? Are you an experience user of syndicated data services from leading industry providers? If so, we’d love to talk with you about our Client Data Analyst position in the Phoenix, AZ market. The Client Data Analyst will work onsite with our retailer team to help them identify and capitalize on their largest growth opportunities. They'll report data findings in a concise manner to be understood by various audiences in the organization and monitor and measure key performance indicators within the position and across the organization. The Analyst will work continuously on process improvement and innovation to increase workflow efficiency within the team and across solutions; working directly with the Client Lead at the retailer supporting existing and to be developed business priorities. The Client Data Analyst must be able to work on multiple projects concurrently, and efficiently leverage SPINS Business Intelligence tool and ad-hoc reporting platforms. Experience using syndicated data services and exceptional Excel & PowerPoint skills are a ‘must have’ for this position. The position reports to the SPINS Client Lead and is based in Phoenix, AZ. WE'LL BE COUNTING ON YOU FOR... Your advanced skills with Excel and PowerPoint. Your relentless attention to detail and passion for new methods and skills. Your comfort working within a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment. Your positive attitude and passion for using data to uncover actionable decisions. Your willingness to be onsite at the client daily and juggle competing priorities and a consistent flow of requests. YOU PROBABLY HAVE... BS in Business or related field Advanced Excel skills Problem solving skills Financial analysis experience 2+ years of data analysis and modeling OR 2+ years of experience using IRI, Nielsen, or SPINS syndicated data in your day-to-day work with retailers and/or CPG brands Experience in quality assurance and testing Data interpretation/data understanding Ability to be onsite at the client full-time

This position is for a thermal analyst in the Central Engineering organization. The candidate will be responsible for leadership and coordination of technical and schedule items for the thermal design, analysis, and testing of missile systems/components during ground operations and all phases of flight. Tasks involve the evaluation of thermal management requirements through the development and execution of analytical models and tests. Tasks also include the execution of software tools to predict and ambient and high speed aerodynamic heating environments and component thermal response, support for component and system ground tests to verify analytical models, and analysis of flight data to verify system performance. In addition, the candidate will provide technical documentation and input to data packages to support peer and customer reviews, present analysis data to engineering teams, customer technical representatives, and Program Office personnel at technical interchange meetings and design reviews, mentor junior engineers and cross-train other engineering disciplines, provide review, interpretation, flowdown, and implementation of program requirements, and plan tasks and monitor budget and schedule to reduce cost and cycle time. Desired Skills: Proven leadership and interpersonal skills. Excellent communication skills and dedication to Mission Success. Creativity/innovation to solve issues related to anomalous performance of any aspect of missile thermal systems. Experience with thermal tests and instrumentation. Knowledge of heatshield/insulation materials. Thermal analysis with missile/rocket systems in particular. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: Thermal analysis experience in the aerospace industry. Extensive understanding and application of heat transfer principles. Proficiency with LM Space standard thermal software (e.g. NX Thermal).
